text: Another night in Las Vegas and I was looking for a non touristy place to hang... found it at ReBAR in the Art District. A great non pretentious bar with a cool back outdoor area and a dirt lot for outdoor parties as well.  Owners seem low key and interested in keeping it affordable in a city of excess.  Cooler shit to buy than any of the knick knack shops on the strip.  With the other cool bars in the area it is a definite bar craw waiting to happen.

Amazing spot! Cool concept, well executed.  Big beer selection, great ambiance. I love the back patio too. The whole place is like several spaces in one, because there are so many different things to see and places to sit and hang out. This neighborhood is getting so cool. Highly recommended!
Food was great, a little slow. Got the vegan kielbasa on the regular bun because the pretzel bun has egg. Excited to see if they come up with a vegan cheese sauce in the future!
If you want a great duck fart in your mouth and deals come to ReBar.  Everyone at the bar is knowledgable and the place is a great place to enjoy a night.

I have to say that I love this bar. My wife and I don't get out together much because of our busy work schedules. The other day we thought we would get out and check out ReBar. What a fun night. We both had a charitable drink, shopped and we played a trivia game. It was an easy, fun night. Everything in the bar is on sale and there is so much to pick from if you want to purchase something. I recommend ReBar if you want to do something a bit different with your cocktails . We will be going back and I will be inviting friends too.

Enjoyable and welcoming.  Didn't really matter what the drinks are but good to know it's ultra cheap and 4 of us kept drinking drink after drink.  The bartender was down to earth, fun, and kept our drinks coming. It's fun to sit at the bar with friends and watch flash back to 1970's & 89's cartoons, commercials, and snippets of old sitcoms on an 1 hour loop on the TV. They also serve hot dogs there- not sure how good they are as I didn't order that. 

I looked around at the nikka-nakka and  didn't buy anything. Some guy did buy some beer steins while we were there.

GREAT PLACE! It was great to walk in and see a familiar face with Shani the bartender! Greeted us with a smile and showed us around the place. Almost EVERYTHING is for sale! Good beer selection and great antiques! I will definitely be back!!

Amazing 90's clips running on the TV.
Very great atmosphere.
Cool and smiling staff and funny bartenders!
GREAT place!!!!
A little hipster douschie but whatever! Good dive for an unpretentious beer. Inside is like a nic nac thrift store.

Very cool spot! Unique combo of dive bar thats not sketchy, board games, great prices, great music, super friendly staff, AND YARD SALE TREASURES. Plenty of free street parking. Thrift stores, antiques, tattoo neighborhood. In the old school wedding chapel neighborhood between strip and Freemont. Near the Stratosphere.
Great atmosphere, friendly staff and yummy drinks. Came here because of a recommendation and we had a great experience

What's not to love about this place? It has it all and it is all for sale along with the drinks. There is a great story behind it too...hopefully you can find the video on Facebook. I met the owner a while back at an auction where he was buying up stuff for this dream of his... so great to see it came to fruition and is such a hit in the Antique Alley district. Fun to see what he did with all the random auction stuff too!

My kinda hangout....
*disclosure* when its not busy :D

On a Saturday night I saw some real douche nozzles actually come in soo drunk, the chicks tit was about to fall out and she was screaming "wheres my shot????!!!!" then one of the guys fell backwards out of a nice chair and broke it.... Needless to say they "left" shortly after.

Anywho. Vegan dawgs with the works!!!!!! Pickled onion, sauerkraut, regular and brown mustard, brown mustard, relish, dill pickle spear. All on a nice pretzel bun.
(the dawg is FieldRoast)
Thats what I get.

Hubs gets plain with regular mustard and relish.

Their "Blowout Beer" changes and its usually a nice IPA. My friend she usually gets that really cute Mexican Coke drink, comes in a cut half bottle of Coke.

Hubs gets the Merlot on tap. 

All the specialty drinks part of the money goes to charity.

I love all the stuff everywhere and you can buy it all, its all for sale.

Come and watch the 80's-90's clips of old commercials, movies, and tv shows. Wow it really brings back memories.

Where else can you catch EXCLAMATION! perfume commercial ads back to back with Tron! movie shots?!?!

We love this place . Everything from the glass your drinking out of to the chair your sitting in is For Sale ! Great place! Feels like your at home drinking in your living room with your family and friends . Great Bartenders friendly atmosphere . It's so nice to go to a bar and not come out smelling like a ash tray . Smoking out side With a great outside patio area to sit in If your looking for a Awsome unique Bar this place is your place Comon By

A new and unique bar.... non smoking !!..... drink and shop, drink and shop..... found some cool items to buy and some great beers to drink...... wines are on tap too..... no stale bottle wines..... Meli and I love this place...... great people and great music...... right on Main Street the ARTS/antiques shopping district.

Now this is the place to relax and unwind. The hole places decor is very unique. You can see a lot or treasures of quirky decor and the best part is that it's for sale. I truly enjoy or green there mystery beer because literally you never know what you're going to get and deliciously enough you can also order a yummy hot dog or warm pretzel to pair It Off. Inside it's very Warm & Cozy always friendly and pet friendly if you're in the back side patio. I am very happy to have come to this place. Parking is plentiful and the best part is that the price is extremely budget friendly .

This place is my favorite spot in all of Vegas. Great people, chill environment, fun entertainment and easy-free parking. An awesome spot for meeting and hoping around the Arts District. But go elsewhere for food (Tacos Huevos or Cornish Pasty).

Quirky little place where everything is for sale. Went there for mini mardi grad... cute interesting little parade with beads and all! Decent prices for drinks... fun atmosphere... they were a little busy so maybe it took a little longer for service... purchased a doll from the restroom that we named "shi**er vanna"... treasured memories... friendly customers! Will go back!!

ReBAR is the perfect little bar I never knew I needed, until I went last night! When we first arrived I spent a solid 15 minutes just wandering around looking at all of the art, antiques and miscellaneous things for sale -amazing!- The music was fun and the videos were playing on the TVs. Our bartender was a sweetheart and very informative about the drinks. We opted for a few off of the mixed cocktail menu. Each of the cocktails had portions of the profit going to charities around the city! We tried a couple Moscow mules- it was my friend's first time ever trying one and they were hooked. I also had the sangria (red) which was also tasty. Their small food menu had delicious options including at least one vegan option. There was plenty of seating on couches, chairs, bar stools as well as covered and uncovered outdoor area seating. We took advantage and sat/stood in almost every area. 
I will be back here again, perfect hidden gem for those who want a fun bar outside of the packed overpriced bars on the strip

Chill laidback vibe. Great place to grab a beer and drink with friends. You can buy any of the decor. This place is frequented by a lot of artsy types. Every time I go here I run into an actor, photographer, Director, or model that I know.

This is a very unique spot to grab a drink and some food.  It's located downtown on Main Street in a quirky little area that most visitors would find unless you went looking for it, but you should.  

It looks like your grandmother's living room but everything is for sale.  The TVs show loops of shows, commercials and videos from the 80's.  It's a very fun, relaxing environment.  Great place to have a drink with friends.  

Speaking of drinks, one of the more affordable places to grab a cocktail.  In addition, their specialty cocktails benefit local charities.  I had the Afterschool Mule which benefits After School All Stars and my husband had the Opportunity Gin and Tonic which benefits Opportunity Village.  Both were delicious.

A note about food - they serve John Mull's meats - a local company with great quality food.  If you're looking for a meal you're limited to kielbasa, hot links or brats.  Not a bad thing, just be prepared.

This bar is unlike anywhere I've ever been. Never before have I been to an antique store that also serves alcohol or vice versa. As others have mentioned everything is for sale! Literally! 

Prefer gaming bars? They've got cool trivia cards and other games scattered about that make up for them not having mindless money eating machines. Also the indoor area is non smoking but they do have a "backyard" outside that allows it FYI.

My favorite things about this bar other than the obligatory adoration for all their things: 1. May seem odd but... that powdered soap in the bathroom! ReBAR, if you were contriving patron nostalgia, you have certainly succeeded with your soap decisions that brought me back to elementary school. 2. VEGAN KIELBASA with the works on a regular bun (pretzel bun is sadly not vegan) hit the spot. All ingredients were so fresh and tasty. It DID take a long time for our food to show up but food is made fresh to order so there's really no room for complaints... plus your bartender is making these so keep that in mind when the place is packed! 3. Absolut after school mule. If you like Moscow mules or just anything ginger this drink will not disappoint. Promise. 

Awesome place to drink downtown, I recommend everyone checks this gem out!

This place is awesome. Great beer list. Great bartender. Has really great prices on about a dozen or so craft beers and has a ton of drink specials on 3 for 4 dollar specials. I like how it doesn't feel like the strip. Located in the arts district it's got a very cool vibe. Also has a decent food list with sausages and pretzels.

Rebar is awesome! Right in the arts district downtown, this awesome little bar is super fun and really unique. I can't wait to come back. I'm very curious about their hotdogs, but the drinks were simple and delightful.

Still catching up on my long list of reviews and sorted though all the pics I've been posting on my Instagram. Just off the Strip. I came here for.....wait for it....the Vegan dog. We saw it listed on Trip Advisor so we decided to try it. For starters I've had a lot of veggie dogs even though I am not vegetarian, especially after a concert when there's the hot dog guy outside the venue. The veggie dog was very sub par to be honest. I was not impressed with the hype, however, for what it is I was satisfied. If you're in the area go for it. I think what failed with the hot dog was that there wasn't a good arrangements of spices in the actual dog itself. It was bland. Maybe it is their supplier or they make it in house. I wish that I had touched based to find this out. It gets high marks for other reasons in my books outside the dog itself. The atmosphere is weird and eclectic in a good way as there is a bar similar in Vancouver called The Furniture Warehouse that more of less mimics this. Everything is for sale. There were a few pop culture things that intrigued us but nothing that we could safely travel home with. The staff were friendly to us.

Our second stop of the night while bar hopping downtown and we loved this place.  Decor is so eclectic.  Pretty cool to look around and check the stuff out.  Board games are scattered about.  Really great clientele.  We love to people watch and you find the best locals here.  Love that it's not filled with tourists.  We didn't have grub and all ordered the Mules.  $8.00 a piece - sweet price but could be a little stiffer.  ;)  Nice bartender.  Nice bouncer.  Super chill place.  We will totally be back.

This is a totally fun and unique bar. It's relatively empty in the afternoons and packed crazy on weekend nights. It's like if you dropped a bar inside a cool, kitschy antique store. And well, that's just totally awesome. There's so many fun things to see on the walls and everywhere. And they show retro TV shows too! Ducktails FTW! Seriously, Ducktails was on TV while I was there. The beer is decent. They have some food offerings. It's just kinda sucky when it's crazy packed. Good luck getting the attention of a bartender. And that bartender definitely won't be friendly.

Super fun.  Super fun and there's random crap you can buy.  I don't really mean crap, I mean TREASURES of course.  
Their drink menu was much more impressive than the standard PBR, rum and coke, bar I was expecting.  My companions got a Moscow Mule and a nice glass of wine and I had a Stella (yeah I'm hard core classy like that).  They also have food - did ya know?  They even have vegan hotdogs which I did not order because, you know why?? Because they had bratwurst from a local farm!  They even served it to me on a pretzel bun.  Joy, rapture!
After consuming our tasty food we adjourned to the back patio to stare at all of the amazing things out there and play one of the board games they have on hand (Sorry!).  
As it turns out that was the night of the 48 hour film festival and for a measley $5 we got to watch AND judge the quality video submissions.
Really, really love this bar.  From the concept, to the Exceptional bartender (thanks Devin!), to the fun events, it's a win no matter what night of the week you go.

Ever since I saw this place pop up on my Facebook page I have thought it was a great concept.  Finally got the chance to stop by and check it out. Funky little bar that is part of an antique store.  They have some cool and eclectic items for sale and a nice bar with some classic beers. I had an Olympia Beer and my girlfriend had one of their charity drinks.  They donate a percentage of the proceeds from certain drinks to charity. That's a nice touch! Will definitely be back for trivia night or First Friday.

This review is a bit weird as I didn't get a drink or food, I kind of just hung out here, twice, in the same night.  The place is cool, a bit narrow, in a bad (to me) part of town, but I felt safe inside.  There were a lot of cool people, games, an outside area, and you can buy almost anything in the place which is an odd yet satisfying feature.  

Like I said, I didn't have a drink or eat here but if I wanted to, nobody asked me which I found a bit annoying as I was standing right near the bar.  I would go here again and actually have drinks but until I do, I can't give it past 3 stars.

This place is amazing. It's filled with antiques and odd treasures for sale, giving it an incredibly unique atmosphere. The owner was really friendly, and they also have weekly events like trivia and outdoor movie nights. I wish there was a place like this close to where I live!!

What a cool concept for a bar! Shopping for vintage/antiques + drinking = empty bank account

I came here after shopping and perusing the vintage stores around and stopped in for a drink. The owner (I believe), Bruce, was really nice and accommodating. He told us everything in the bar was for sale, from the glasses we drank out of to the chairs we sat on. Lots of nice mid century modern furniture, tchotchkes, glassware, etc. Prices for both drinks and items were reasonable. Definitely a nice local spot and off the beaten path from the chaos from the strip.
awesome spot! Rolling Rock on draft! Try the sausages!

SARAH AND ERIC are always on their game with keeping us happy and laughing. The vibe is always chill for a local spot to hang out with other Vegas natives. My favorite part is when I come in and they know exactly what kind of beer I should order if any new drinks come in.
Love this place.. did I mention they have a random Blowout Tap.. $3 or $1 during happy hour
Dope place. Enjoying the hoppy birthday on tap and the vegan kielbasa as I write this review.

This place is awesome! They have so many cool things on the walls like antiques, neon signs, old paintings and cool board games. The service was good. The beer was nice and cold. They also have food but I did not order any food from there. I recommend this place to everyone.

A crazy idea that totally works! This place is has a great atmosphere and there's always something on the wall to talk about. The owner has merged antiques and booze to create a something you'd never find on the strip. See something on the wall you like? Take it home with you! Everything is for sale! This place also features one-of-a-kind art pieces from local artists. There are also cocktails on the menu that contribute to local charities. All in all this a great local spot that caters to the DTLV community.
Awesome place. Definitely not as much of a dive bar as the Double Down, but super chill and unique. If you love beer and booze and a unique environment, come to this place.

Freakin awesome! Long time fan of rolling rock, which they happen to have on draft--not very common in town. Lots of other choices to pick from too though, not to mention the board/card games and the fact that everything is for sale also adds bonus points.
My fave stop for solo meals. The hot dogs and service are not to be missed. Great vibes all around

You know that old gifting question, "What do you get, for the person who has everything?" ReBAR has the answer!

This place is fantastic not only for the obvious fact that you can buy anything and everything right off the walls but also for the community support factor ingrained in the spirit of this place. 

ReBAR serves local craft beers, has a fully stocked bar and a charitable cocktail menu, yes, there's an entire drink menu dedicated to supporting local NPOs. For example, if you were to get the "Preservation Press" you're supporting the Nevada Preservation Society,  A Moscow Mule benefits the After-School All- Stars, or purchase a Stiegle Beagle and help local Vegas animal shelters, and the list keeps going! 

ReBAR also serves sausages provided by John Mulls Meats, a local meat market, and with every sausage served you're supporting Three Square food bank. Now after you've done all that helping it's time to spoil yourself! Need an authentic German beer stein? ReBAR has it, how about a Teddy Ruxpin and a "Grubby the Worm" toy, neons beer signs, a Maggie Simpson doll, weird Vegas paraphernalia, or a matching Vinyl Red Couch set? This place has everything you could think of and a bunch of crazy shit you most likely can't even imagine. 

So click your heels three times and say there's no place like ReBAR! By the way, if you need ruby red shoes, I think I saw some near the video arcade game on the outdoor patio.

Tonight this place was packed with Yelp Elites socializing amongst each other, sipping on their beers and munching on complimentary chips. 

I found this place quite fascinating with everything being on sale. It wasn't only a bar, it was also a thrift shop! Everything was for sale, said the gentleman that greeted us when we came in.

I ordered their hot dog with the pretzel bun, with a simple deli mustard, and melted cheese. While the hot dog itself was delicious, the bun was a little hard to chew. It was also slightly strange to me that ketchup wasn't an option under their offers condiments. They did have deli mustard, yellow mustard, sauerkraut, relish, pickled onions and melted cheese. It also came with pickles but instead of putting it on the side, they had it inside my hotdog. They should be mindful that some people don't like pickles so they should keep it on the side. 

The bartenders were busyyyyy tonight but they were attentive and very pleasant to interact with!
BEST BAR EVER! Love the atmosphere! Love the stuff for sale! Fun games to play!! Owner is AWESOME! Very cool place....very unique!! You should definitely go check out this place!! You'll love it!!

The signage says it all:  "Beer Booze Bargains."  And all in a retro atmosphere!

This bar/antique and vintage store is a welcome oasis in the center of Las Vegas' growing Arts District.  When your partner, spouse, family, friends, or S.O. are getting their vintage on, you can escape the heat/crowds/sun in ReBAR - sipping a cool one, snacking, and just strolling the merchandise filled interior!  Lots of kitchy, retro items to make you smile, bar/beverage related, and tons of other fun stuff.

I noticed they offer "Charitable Cocktails" on their menu - with portions of proceeds benefiting local organizations.  Great idea!  

The staff is great - and whether you are one person ordering a single soft drink - or a big rowdy bunch ordering a big tray load of apps and brews, you are welcome for as long as your heart desires!

Super cool, and fun.  Definitely will make this a stop on my future Arts District jaunts!

The place has a great vibe and is a cool concept. I think it might appeal to out-of-town guests, especially international visitors. For me, it was probably a one-time visit, just because it's not my kind of thing. Service was very friendly. I like that they had some local brews, but unfortunately I'm not a beer drinker. The drink menu didn't blow me away, but I do like that they each are connected to a charity. Excellent concept.

Imagine a garage sale, thrift shop set up like a bar yes you can buy any item decorated around the bar including the chairs out back. Love the front glass displays being super funny and funky at the same time. This place being next the the theatre was perfect for an intermission break.
They serve nice beer options and food! Nothing fancy but great late night bar bites. :)

Awesome, quirky, must-stop kinda place for drinks and curiosity. They have an excellent selection of beers, and a full bar. Now, they even have fancy hot dogs, even a vegan option. 

Rebar is always on my weekend itinerary, and I love to take my friends here. There is always something to look at. Amazing concept!

This is the coolest concept ever! You can get your drink on while shopping for antiques. The owners are some of the nicest people on earth who have put a lot of love into the space. The drinks are super affordable and there's a wide selection. Some of their special drinks have a portion of the proceeds go to charity. You'll love it. Eclectic. Vegas. Fun!

Cool antique vibe and fun atmosphere on the inside.  Patio in the back for some outdoor seating and games.  Solid beer selection with many locals and some daily $3-$5 beer deals.  Some cocktails in the $8-$9 range.  But no prices on the beer menu which is a pet peeve of me.  Overall a nice addition to the area to bar hop with Hop Nuts, Velveteen Rabbit, and the Arts District proper.

This is such a fun bar! They have all sorts of antiques and whatnots inside that they sell and decorate. They have a few games in the back and trivia cards inside that you can play with your friends. They have tvs that show old commercials and music videos.

I usually get their blowout which is whatever is on tap that they're trying to get rid of. It's $3!!! This place has the cheapest beers and it's not a bad selection either. They also have food but I haven't tried it.

Definitely recommend this place. It just has a relaxed, cool vibe inside. The people are really nice too.

Great vibe and great bar.  Have hot dogs (including vegan dog) lmk, pretzels and Sun chips only but it felt like a perfect choice here.  Everything is for sale which makes it a truly unique experience.  Very eclectic place that has a lot of beer choices.

A fun time. Antiques and drinks ( a cool concept ) . Friendly staff. Large selection of beers. Check it out. Don't have much more to add to what has already been written. I will go back next time I am in Las Vegas.
My all time favorite bar. The people who work here are so amazing and the drinks are cheap! Some even go to charity. Definitely check it out!
Really cool bar. Fun time for an evening. Had the Jell-O shots and tried to win a motorbike

Thrift/antique shop + bar? Interesting concept that was executed well. Just about every item in the place is for sale. The chairs, the pillows, the paintings on the walls...All for sale! I especially liked the patio area in the back. Lots of places to sit and lots of conversation pieces. Unfortunately, I had to knock a single star off because the cocktails were...disappointing. However, I did appreciate the fact that money spent on their specialty drinks goes towards different local charities. I ordered the Huntridge old fashioned, which benefits the beloved Huntridge Foundation, but it tasted like watered-down Fire Ball. Sigh... Maybe they'll get it right next time? I'll be back.

This is the most unique bar I've ever been to. There was so much cool vintage stuff to look at (and buy) which was perfect for my ADD personality. It's my kind of neighborhood bar - the style, the atmosphere, the attitude. I felt so comfortable there! It was great to talk to the bartenders and learn about the bar and neighborhood history. Everyone was so welcoming and nice. I'll be going back to Vegas for a bachelorette party in June and I'll be sure to add this to our party tour.  Can't wait!

Very cool place, and such a cool concept! Literally EVERYTHING in the bar is for sale. There is a great local beer selection, and the bonus...there are some killer finds here too! 

Highly recommended as a pit stop when traveling between the Strip and Fremont.

Gotta  put in a word for one of my fave spots to grab a drink on Main. The vibe is always positive, Shawnie and Derek are super awesome, and there's always new stuff to look at. This is my new go to spot when I have friends or family in town and they want to see what downtown is really about.

Visiting from Phoenix, a few  friends were looking to get a tattoo and we saw this bar next door, so a couple of us came in for just a quick drink. The atmosphere and decor was so unique and fun. The bartender on duty, Josh, was very friendly and had a great knowledge of beers and beverages. A drink and a beer soon turned into one after the other and we spent the entire afternoon there laughing and listen to live music while we drank.  

So if you are looking for a fun place with the best prices and selections of beer and the tastiest cocktails, THIS IS YOUR BAR!  We plan to visit again when we come back to Vegas in the fall!!!

Love this place! I wasn't sure what to expect when I heard the concept but the second I walked in I could tell it worked! Staff is super friendly and helpful. Also, I really love the fact that they have Charity drinks where proceeds go to a designated local charity!! Wine list could have a few more options but don't think it's what they are going for in terms of drinks. Definitely worth checking out!!

Decided that after the empowering female celebration time at the Velveteen Rabbit across the with High Priestess Tea that a good beer sounded amazing. Rebar is that laid back bar too that we all celebrate in movies. It's such an eccentric mess that it is a crazy Happy clutter which makes it have such personality. Here they celebrate the weird and wild. Where a deer head could be seen by Darth Vadar and not be weird!

As always the staff here is friendly and had my order done with the snap of the finger. I ordered the beer that was on tap which was Rolling Rock. It's your typical beer but very smooth and Rolling Rock does not have any bitter after tastes. 

Came to eat lunch and not feeling totally meat today I decided to have imaginary meat. I ordered the Vegan Fields Roast Sausage on a pretzel bun with mustard, kraut, and sweet relish. I loved how the vegan dog tasted amazing plain. It needed to be dressed up so adding all this fantastic flavors makes it so sweet, especially the relish. Every time I visit Rebar I am totally impressed by the music, amazing atmosphere, delicious food Oh, forgot the most important; beer too!
Finally made it out tonight. So impressed. Lates back cool surroundings. Outside and in. Great service. Super nice bartenders. Everyone belongs here

How does anyone give ReBAR any less than 5 stars? 

I don't drink alcohol too often. In fact, it has been years since the last time I had a buzz. But that doesn't mean I will not enjoy a drink or two when we're celebrating a special occasion. I recently met up with my girlfriend and her son to celebrate his 21st Birthday. Happy Birthday to a special a special young man!!! We also bumped into Misti (former Vegas Yelp CM) and Bobby Yang. The overall vibe of this bar is cool and the drinks are very inexpensive. I had a shot of Grandma's Apple Pie with Terri's son and was leaning towards a Ballast Point due to my 619 roots. I ended up with a Rolling Rock since I'm a light weight.  Because I'm such light weight, I immediately felt the buzz.  I had a great time.

The bar is very cozy and sports a shaded patio in the back. ReBAR is unique in that almost everything that you see inside the bar is for sale. The bar also has a list of drinks dubbed their "Charitable Cocktails", in which portions of the proceeds benefit different foundations. Pretty Cool!!

Overall, I had a very good time with family. The staff is great, the drinks affordable, and importantly, the proceeds from some of their drinks go to a good cause.
I'm required to review this downtown bar in order to win the motorbike raffle. This post has to be somewhat long in order to fulfill the requirement.

An antique store that's also a bar? So, the glass you are literally drinking out of you can buy. You like the German coo coo clock on the wall? You can buy it. You fancy the old Budweiser lamp there on the piano? You can buy it. You like the old Miller Time beer stein? You can buy it! That cute salt and pepper shaker set or the Santa tchotchke over there? You can buy it! 
The bartenders are friendly and attentive, the drinks are stiff and more affordable than other bars, too! Cha-Ching!! My hubby and our friend ordered the all beef hot dogs with the pretzel bun and loved it. They went on and on about it for awhile, luckily I was pretty blasted out of my mind, so I don't remember tons. 
The concept of ReBar is unique and interesting and we will definitely return. 
The total for one Tito's and club, 3 big beers, a pretzel sticks plate with German mustard and processed Stadium-style cheese, and two ginormous wieners with mustard and sauerkraut that offered fodder for the next 30 minutes, $42.00. 
Fantastic!

This is a great downtown bar. It's right in the middle of the developing art district. The bartenders are usually pretty quick to serve the drinks and the place is a good time to drink and browse the antiques they have for sale

I heard this place was interesting, so I go to check it out. It was pretty creepy/trippy on the inside. I ordered a drink and the bartender said he knew that I was going to order that drink as soon as I came in and I was a stereotypical white girl, he fulfilled the stereotype of an asshole hipster, working at a hipster bar, making fun of people to their faces, he made me so uncomfortable I will not be coming back

Imagine if all that crazy crap on the walls at TGIFridays was for sale -- after a few mudslides, you could be the proud owner of a pair of 1930s snowshoes or an old road sign splashed with mook-puke! 

Well, that's the basic concept here. I'll be honest, when I first heard about this joint, I groaned and rolled my eyes -- another twee hipster startup: a curio-filled bar that is actually a secondhand store! JUST WHAT I ALWAYS WANTED!

Shtick aside, this place is actually super cool. The junk-tiques are fun and interesting, and interactively scattered about everywhere. The vibe is like getting sloshed in your grandma's attic or your boozy uncle's basement mancave. Fabulous!

More importantly, the drinks are very reasonably priced and the staff is unpretentious -- unlike other area bars with egg-white-frothing mustachioed mixologists, etc. This is a fun, solid place to a drink or three...especially if you want to avoid the douchebags and parking hassles of East Fremont. Here, there is street parking all around, and you should be able to park for free most days. Plus, you're within walking distance of plenty of interesting shops, galleries, food and drink spots.

East Fremont is sooooo 2016; 2017 is all about the Arts District!

Hands down, this is the absolute BEST bar in Las Vegas! Located off of Main Street and Colorado Ave, this precious gem is conveniently placed on the border of the Arts District and Downtown Las Vegas, which makes it perfect location for locals as well as the adventurous tourists who want to branch away from the chaos on Fremont street. 

From the moment I walked in the door of this fantastic place, my eyes were overwhelmed with amazement as I glanced around at all the novelty items in this bar. You can literally buy any item they have in this bar! From 70s furniture, to classic board games, and even random Christmas ornaments to add to your holiday collection. Also, Rebar accepts donations, so if you happen to have an item or two that you'd like to surrender to the Rebar facility, any bartender would be happy to take it off your hands. I donated a JC *NSYNC doll and one of the bartenders, Shawnee, gave me a free sangria as a thank you for my donation! 

So besides the awesome atmosphere this establishment has, I have to confess that I truly love Rebar for their insanely cheap drinks. As a Vegas local, I'm always searching for a bar that serves quality drinks at reasonable prices. Rebar does just that. Not to mention, their Moscow Mules and house made sangria are pure heaven. They also have a food menu composed of some of the best sausages you'll ever have (the bar gets them from John Mulls RoadKill Grill which is a delicious bbq joint in North Las Vegas). 

Also, they have trivia nights on Mondays where large groups of friends get together and compete against other teams in six different trivia rounds. The winning team gets a $50 Rebar gift card! Pretty sweet deal to reward your ever so sweet victory. 

Looking forward to my next venture into Rebar and you should be to!
What an awesome spot- Phillip behind the bar was super welcoming. Although our first time here, made us feel like we were "regulars".

Cool theme thrift bar, you literally buy whatever you want from this place. I was almost tempted to get those *NSYNC dolls lol There was this vodka lemonade drink that was very good, can't remember the name :/ Anyways, overall fun and comfy place to get drinks with your friends

Awesome concept and great atmosphere.  Located in the heart of antique ally, this place lets you get your fill of cold drinks and smokin hot deals on very cool antiques.  This place is filled with vintage neon signs, cool furniture, and tons of items for your home.  The staff is fantastic serving up great drink specials (you have to try to the After School Mule).  Bravo to everyone at ReBar.  Keep up the good work.  When in Vegas, you have to visit this place!

This bar has a fantastic vibe. It's an antique store and Tavern where everything including the glasses are for sale. It was really cool to walk through the store and check out the antiques. They also have tons of bored games like cards against humanity to entertain you. 

If you enjoy going to places that are different and are off the beaten path, check this place out.

This place is a hidden gem. I came here to try the vegan sausage with a pretzel bun and I wasn't disappointed. (Get all the fixings for a real hotdog experience) When we went they had draft beer on special for a $1! Everything in the bar is for sale so if you're into antiques the whole bar is a showroom. They even have a stage outside behind the bar for events. Free parking behind the bar!

Located in the Arts District in Downtown Las Vegas. This joint is extremely groovy. Vintage chachkies are all around, and for sale. Great drink and food specials, all combined with a terrific staff. So get off the strip, unless you like being treated like a second class citizen in your own town, come down to the Arts District and immerse yourself in the grooviness.  Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!
I love this place the bar tenders are not rude at all and not one slight of judgment when you walk in i love it
Really fab bar, nice respite while checking out the great retro and vintage stores all along the block; nicely priced beers; bartenders full of local tips!

I wish they sold food other then hotdog (which is very good I may say) some more nostalgia food and snacks would help. Fun Yuns  and now later's. But I tell you what these people did their homework  playing the best nostalgia  videos ever I mean ever

I'll admit the first time I walked in here it was pretty cool.  We live in the area and frequent quite a few bars around here.  We stumbled in over a month back and were sort of drawn in by the antiques and the old school vibe.  It was the same guy we've seen in here bartending since then.  Nice guy but service is s-l-o-w.  The first time we were in we went to the bar, grabbed our drinks and sat at the red old school couch.  Not comfy but very cool.  

We wanted to stop in about two weeks ago now on a Saturday before the Velveteen Rabbit opened across the street and I'm almost wishing we didn't because the service was so bad I'm not sure we'll ever go back.  Granted, it was a tad busy, far from overwhelming but there was the same guy behind the bar and another lady.  We perched up sort of right at the bar as you walk in to the left.  I know she saw us as she came and grabbed something right from the bar next to us.  She didn't acknowledge us and I could tell she had that busy look.  So we waited.  The other guy was filling orders for people walking up to the bar and glanced over at us once or twice but never came over.  I was ready to roll out as it was annoying but my wife wanted me to wait another about five minutes.  Still, literally no one came over or took a drink order.  It was probably the worst service I've seen in the bars in the area.  Cool vibe but what's going to keep people coming back here after the coolness of the place wears off is the customer service.  And if it's normally like we saw that day it needs an improvement.

Great neighborhood bar with draft craft and lots of can-bottle options!  My hubby and i have made this our go-to spot.  I love that they have wine on tap, always fresh.  No slot tops, no smoking, no shame.  Style is vintage antique store meets dive-bar and it's awesome, in the heart of Antique Alley.  Antique Alley is our favorite shopping street in Vegas and after a afternoon of browsing, this is the best place to have refreshments.  Everything in the bar is for sale, old beer signs, beerstiens, vintage neon, furniture, glassware and cuckoos!!!  I love the outdoor smoking patio, its like being at Gram Parsons camp in Joshua Tree, so chill!

Folks,  it simply doesn't get better than this! Down to earth friendly bar with the best hot link dog I have ever had! Not to mention an enormous beer And full bar selection. If your overwhelmed, just ask Shani and she will ask you questions about your mood, and then select the perfect beer.  Do yourself a favor and check this place out, and don't forget that everything is for sale including the seat your sitting on and glass your drinking out of.

$3.00 draft. Cocktails that benefit charities. Kick ass antiques for sale. Recycled booze bottles.  Craft beers  and old school beers.  Rad bar owner.  I saw this place on TV about 2 months ago. I've been waiting for it to open. It surpassed my expectations.  This place it's going the change the downtown area.  Get-there!

I love the vibe and concept.


What a great fun and lively atmosphere and this place definitely gets it.  Just what the Downtown and the 18b Arts District needs a with fantastic local beers.  Bad Beat, Tenaya Creek, Big Dogs, Crafthaus to name a few are all available.

  Everything in the place has a price (if not ask the bartender) from the glass you are drinking out of.. lava lamps.. postcards... the art on the wall... you see it you can take home with you. (minus the steins behind the bar)  there is something here for everyone. 

The steins behind the bar all belong to patrons and ReBar stores them for return visits or you can take it home of course what's the fun in that.   If you happen to find one that "speaks" to you pick it up and feel like the Kool Kids and impress your guests upon your eventual return.


 Friendly service, outstanding prices on drinks and they serve John Mulls Meat sausages, hot links and have vegan options as well.  Current promotion is a Motobike giveaway that will happen Fat Tuesday!

Definitely worth making the trip for!!

I'm here for the yelp elite event and the service has been consistent. Bruce as well as other staff has been coming around nonstop asking us how everything's been. Good variety on tap and cocktails have been strong. At the end I decided to go for their gourmet dogs and was not disappointed. Will be back at the end of February when they have a raffle I joined. Awesome place and great service. When here try the German Edel beer.
Cute little bar that also sales antiques. Great prices on drinks and awesome bartender. Food available as well but we had already had lunch. Woyld def come again.
Awesome! First time here. Non smoking, friendly, everything is for purchase and great service. Full bar and free board games. Can't go wrong with a group of friends.

LOVE REBAR! Been coming here regularly (after our Hoppy Runs) or occasionally during the weekend. They carry Rekogderlig cider (if you haven't had it, you don't know what you're missing!), along with a random $3 beer that's different everytime. Great staff, games and decent vegan hot dogs!

The staff also recently recovered my husband's wallet he left there - which was so great. Cannot thank them enough!

Eccentric, collective, artsy mood stabilizing establishment serving awesome cocktails and always offering $1.00 to $3.00 beer!  Wanna shop... everything in this joint is for sale...so sit, sip, and peruse the bar.   Definitely a must see... and it's on Main St.!

I've seen a lot of good reviews and I live in the neighborhood.   So I decided to stop by this afternoon and check it out. 

Cool space,  extremely nice vibe.   Old Johnny Cash playing as I walked in the door.   No football on the screens   though.   Nice bar, retro.   I sat in the middle and made eye contact with the bartender when I arrived.   There were 6 other patrons.   I was the only newcomer. 

That's where it got strange.   Bartender started fiddling with the cash register and chatting with patrons 3 stools away.   For over 5 minutes.   Then she walked away to the back.   Meanwhile,  I sat and waited.   Finally I decided to bail after 6-7 minutes. 

NOTE to proprietor.   This is a NEIGHBORHOOD bar.   The neighbors in this hood will support you if you welcome them and provide friendly service.   I got the big-ass cold shoulder today in your bar.   I won't be back.

UPDATE:  Derek, who owns ReBar, contacted me via Yelp.  He was apologetic and took time to review camera footage from the day I was at ReBar.  Impressive.  I plan to give it another shot this week and update my review accordingly.
A bar in Vegas without slots, is non-smoking, and it's an antique store?! I didn't know this was something missing from my life till now. What a great place!

Such a unique bar! Loved everything on the inside. Had a wide variety of beer, especially local and I don't think I've seen better prices for beer at too many other bars. Everything seems reasonably priced on the menu. Can't wait to go back!

This place is awesome! Great drink and food prices! I loved that they had antiques everywhere and all of it was for sale! They also had games you could play, my coworkers and I decided to play Cards Against Humanity for some good unconventional fun! Very interesting and fun yet laid back bar. Highly recommend!

Love love love ReBar!  There is just no other place like it. The nostalgia of all the little odds and ends in there is just great. If you want to chill, you can play jenga or trivia card games with friends. The drinks are cool too. A few craft beer options, which is awesome. The staff have friendly and helpful. It's a great spot for a Friday or Saturday night.

Love this spot that's all I can say. Awesome atmosphere and everything in the damn place is for sale. 
 Today we sat out back with our dogs.

I really liked the vibe of this bar. As soon as you walk in you are surrounded by antiques and random items. 

The bar is eclectic as they come. 

Dollar beers before 3pm. 

The prices are not bad at all. The food menu is super cool and has a variety of things for anyone to choose. 

There are board games all around the bar, encouraging patrons to hang out and have a good time. 

I was near here for an event so I couldn't stay for to long but I plan on returning with some friends to enjoy this bar. 

Thumbs up!

Had an opportunity to return here recently and it refreshed my recollection that this place is truly unique here in Vegas, combining a bar/coffee shop atmosphere with an antique shop.  According to the staff, EVERYTHING (including the glasses, barstools, etc) are for sale.  The place is filled with antique furniture, wall hangings, games, chairs, tables, and the like.  For food, they have several different styles of bratwurst, polish sausage, or hot dogs.  These are not small portions either.  There is a small patio in the back as well.  Definitely a place to check out after First Friday or when barhopping.  With several bars and restaurants open or opening in this part of town, this should be a happening spot!
It's a Goodwill crossed with your favorite local bar. Everything is for sale, drink prices are fine, and the staff is cool.
Beer, wine, bargains...repurposed items, antiques, passionate owner on premise...as good as it gets.  Derek...good on ya.

Had a blast here last night - great atmosphere, amazing concept executed perfectly, awesome music at the perfect volume, and Bruce and Shani are wonderful.  Tons of seating for groups, and no smoking indoors (awesome back patio area for smokers and water bowls for your four-legged friends, though).  The selection of items to buy is so well curated, it's really incredible.  They have Socktoberfest coming up - check out the details on their Facebook page, and support this new addition to Main Street!  Never change, Rebar!

PUT YOUR MONEY WHERE YOUR HEART IS
ReBAR, part bar and part antique shop, is the result of owner Derek Stonebarger pursuing his dreams after experiencing a serious health scare.  I'm not one to really hang out in bars, but I had to check out this new Downtown Las Vegas spot after hearing so much good buzz, namely the fact that it's a business which gives back to the community.  In addition to having beer (over 50 kinds, including many from local breweries) and wine, you can purchase Charitable Cocktails with a portion of the proceeds from these drinks benefiting local non-profits.  I had the Absolut After-School Mule for $8 with a portion of the proceeds going to the After-School All-Stars.  Food options include gourmet pretzels, Polish sausage, vegan kielbasa, chips, and John Mull's hot links and bratwurst.

The antique shop element of ReBAR is the other unique aspect here.  Everything in the bar is for sale, from the stools you sit on to the glasses you drink out of.  There are tons of things to look at and more stuff out back on the patio.  I will definitely be coming back here knowing that I can hang out, have a drink, and make a small contribution to our community.  Kudos to you, Derek, and welcome to ReBAR.
Really cool bar located in the arts district.  Surrounded by vintage stores and right across the street form the velveteen rabbit.  Friendly staff and an interesting client tell made this a fun stop.

Yikes.  I may have a biased review based on the terrible experience I had and maybe I would come back here one day to see if it's any better but I highly doubt that.

Upon walking in, I trip on a dog.  Yep, that's right.  A small black dog was lying across the path on the black floor.  I didn't see it and I tripped over it.  Of course I'm the bad guy because I've kicked an innocent dog and made it cry.  Apologizing meant nothing to the owner and apparently nor to the staff.  The funny thing is that we were at another bar right before this one where I had a good experience with a sweet German Shepard.  But I'm Cruella Devile in this situation and the first bartender pretends I'm not even there after giving me the dirtiest look in the world.  I mean she could have turned me to stone with this look.  I should have just walked right out at this point but I think I was in a state of shock and a few moments later another bartender came by and my friend ordered something so I had to stay at this point.  I have never felt so uncomfortable or unwelcome in all the time I've been in Vegas.

To make matters worse, my friends cocktail was disgusting.  He said he knew the drinks sucked but he liked the vibe of the place and it was nice to hang out there.  My blue moon tasted like blue moon so I guess I couldn't complain about that.  

The sad part is I think I would have liked this place if my attitude wasn't marred by the piss poor attitudes of the staff.  It's called a mistake and I apologized.  But please by all means crucify me.  I'm surprised they didn't kick me out themselves.

Eclectic bar with lots of local brews. Small menu of dogs and brats in a non-smoking, no gambling setting.  There's a covered outdoor patio out back with more "finds" for sale. Might be my new favorite.

This is by far the weirdest bar I have ever been to. 
It's cool that's everything is for sale, but the food options suck. They special beer they recommended me the berry one I think it was...was just awful.
Smelt like cleaning products. 

Do not get the pretzel bites...it's a waste of money. It's just a piece of pretzel bread cut into long pieces. It's not even warmed up or anything.

This is a super funky dive bar and a really chill spot. If I lived here, I'd definitely come here all the time. The prices are very competitive, and there are lots of neat things to gaze at. Truly, this is a very fun spot to gather with a friend or larger group. Beer selection include some local craft cans and drafts, so that's always a good sign. 

Definitely stop in if you're in the area. You won't regret it!
